item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Apple Mobile Processors Are Now Made in America. By TSMC (425 points | 160 comments)
2. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (64 points | 12 comments)
3. Entire Independent Board of Directors of 23andMe Resigns (287 points | 140 comments)
4. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (380 points | 120 comments)
5. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (358 points | 97 comments)
6. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (218 points | 95 comments)
7. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (350 points | 31 comments)
8. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (175 points | 27 comments)
9. John Peralta Explodes Historic Technology into Three-Dimensional Diagrams (25 points | discuss)
10. Reports of the Death of Dental Cavities Are Greatly Exaggerated (68 points | 33 comments)
11. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (183 points | 54 comments)
12. Asgard launches world's first DDR5-9600 DIMMs (5 points | 2 comments)
13. Scrolling Text Display (24 points | discuss)
14. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
15. The Double Irish Dutch Sandwich: End of a Tax Evasion Strategy (166 points | 137 comments)
16. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (79 points | 4 comments)
17. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (140 points | 17 comments)
18. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (721 points | 1630 comments)
19. The Illusion of a Pagan West (4 points | 1 comment)
20. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (228 points | 49 comments)
21. STORM: Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (80 points | 39 comments)
22. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (130 points | 12 comments)
23. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (101 points | 69 comments)
24. The centrality of stupidity in mathematics (224 points | 132 comments)
25. The port of the Windows 95 Start Menu was not all it seemed (8 points | 3 comments)
26. Rustpad is an efficient and minimal open-source collaborative text editor (17 points | 1 comment)
27. Exploring pre-1990 versions of wc(1) (2023) (21 points | 2 comments)
28. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (107 points | 63 comments)
29. TexTube: Chat with any YouTube video transcript in ChatGPT fast (100 points | 66 comments)
30. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (103 points | 32 comments)
